sentence.Network_en: Their success is conditional, I suggest, on this restriction.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为他们能否成功取决于这一限制因素.

sentence.Network_en: Some restriction on funding was necessary.
sentence.Network_cn: 有必要对资金提供加以限制。

sentence.Network_en: The 30 mph speed restriction applies in all built - up areas.
sentence.Network_cn: 每小时限速30英里适用于所有建筑物聚集区.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin restrictio(n-), from restringere 'bind fast, confine' (see restrict)

entry.def: A restriction is an official rule that limits what you can do or that limits the amount or size of something.

example.ex: ...the lifting of restrictions on political parties and the news media...
example.tran: 取消对政治党派和新闻媒体的限制

example.ex: The relaxation of travel restrictions means they are free to travel and work.
example.tran: 旅游限制的放松意味着他们可以自由地出行和工作。

entry.tran: （对行动的）限定，约束，限制因素
entry.def: You can refer to anything that limits what you can do as a restriction.

example.ex: His parents are trying to make up to him for the restrictions of urban living...
example.tran: 他的父母正试图弥补他在城市生活的局限。

example.ex: The second restriction upon the president's power is the limited time at his disposal.
example.tran: 总统权力受到的第二项限制就是可以自由支配的时间有限。

means.word_mean: 1. a principle that limits the extent of something;

sentences.sentence: "I am willing to accept certain restrictions on my movements"

means.word_mean: 2. an act of limiting or restricting (as by regulation)
3. the act of keeping something within specified bounds (by force if necessary)

auth_sentence.content: There has to be a restriction placed on it.
auth_sentence.res_content: There has to be a restriction placed on it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There has to be a restriction placed on it.

auth_sentence.content: The history of calorie restriction diets is abject failure.

stems_affixes.value_cn: [with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的
stems_affixes.word_buile: strict拉紧→adj.[with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 区域, 地方, 管区, 行政区
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+strict拉紧→分开拉,分开管理→分区;区域, 地方
restrict[v.限制,约束]+ion表名词→n.限制,限定,约束
strict[adj.[with]严格的,严厉的;严谨的,精确的]+ure表名词→n.谴责,严厉,束缚

Sentence.sentence: Why do policymakers of alcohol control place density restrictions?

sentences.en: new restrictions aimed at preventing social disorder
sentences.cn: 旨在防止社会动乱的新限制

sentences.en: All these restrictions were swept aside.
sentences.cn: 所有这些限制都不予考虑。

sentences.en: Citizens of the EU can travel without restriction within the EU.
sentences.cn: 欧盟的公民在欧盟境内可以不受限制地出入各国。

sentences.en: The park is open to the public without restriction.
sentences.cn: 这个公园对公众开放, 没有任何限制。

means.word_mean: 管制, 限定;法律, 规章

sentences.en: The 30 mph speed restriction applies in all built-up areas.
sentences.cn: 每小时限速30 英里适用于所有建筑物聚集区。

sentences.en: The removal of petty restrictions has made life easier.
sentences.cn: 对一些琐碎规定的取消使生活更自在了。
